timeline.message: Update SCM to avoid force updating if subscribed to capability
Update SCM to not send GSCR in HMI NONE
Add test to get capability on HMI NONE
Add the new getCapability() method to Isdl
Add the new getCapability() method to LifecycleManager
Update VideoStreamManager to avoid querying for capabilities in HMI NONE
Mark DISPLAYS as auto subscribed when the SCM is created

timeline.author: joeljfischer
joeljfischer

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (proxy.getSystemCapabilityManager() != null) {
if (proxy != null && proxy.getSystemCapabilityManager() != null) {
timeline.author: joeygrover

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (!hmiLevel.equals(HMILevel.HMI_NONE) && VideoStreamManager.this.parameters == null) {
if (!HMILevel.HMI_NONE.equals(hmiLevel) && VideoStreamManager.this.parameters == null) {
timeline.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText: Avoids an NPE if hmiLevel is null but doesn't need an NPE check explicitly.
replies.author: joeygrover

timeline.body: Is this what iOS does? IMO our `currentHMILevel` would be none until we are at least registered on the IVI and even then we are inferring that. However, I'm not sure if it makes much of a difference to simply put this as the initial state or not so if it is what iOS does then this comment can be resolved without action.
timeline.bodyText: Is this what iOS does? IMO our currentHMILevel would be none until we are at least registered on the IVI and even then we are inferring that. However, I'm not sure if it makes much of a difference to simply put this as the initial state or not so if it is what iOS does then this comment can be resolved without action.
timeline.bodyHTML: Is this what iOS does? IMO our currentHMILevel would be none until we are at least registered on the IVI and even then we are inferring that. However, I'm not sure if it makes much of a difference to simply put this as the initial state or not so if it is what iOS does then this comment can be resolved without action.
timeline.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText: Yes, iOS does a similar thing: https://github.com/smartdevicelink/sdl_ios/blob/4f650efc70d853d31b14ccc3e64210f192f3f9b7/SmartDeviceLink/SDLSystemCapabilityManager.m#L97
replies.author: bilal-alsharifi

timeline.body: Do we need the `message` variable here, or couldn't this simply be inline with the `DebugTool` call?
timeline.bodyText: Do we need the message variable here, or couldn't this simply be inline with the DebugTool call?
timeline.bodyHTML: Do we need the message variable here, or couldn't this simply be inline with the DebugTool call?
timeline.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText: I stored the message in var so I can reuse it when I call scListener.onError(message)
replies.author: bilal-alsharifi

timeline.body: There should probably be some null checks here and in the `isCapabilitySupported` methods to make sure that `LifecycleManager.this.systemCapabilityManager` isn't null before simply accessing it.

timeline.message: Add some null checks to LifecycleManager
Add use @link Javadoc annotation to ISdl and SCM
